name: Customer Edge Virtual Local Area Network
title: CE-VLAN
definition: An identifier derivable from a content of a service frame that allows the service frame to be associated with an EVC at the UNI.
validEntryNotes: For a VLAN based map with many to one bundling, multiple four numeric CE-VLANs are returned to describe a list and/or ranges. Each UNI termination point must contain the same set of CE- VLAN values.
Only one four numeric CE-VLAN entry is returned for all other VLAN based map types.
usageNotes: Required when the associated NCI field on the EVC Form specifies a VLAN based map and a CE-VLAN is assigned by the provider, otherwise prohibited.
exampleNotes: This example depicts a single CE-VLAN entry. Multiple single entries may be populated to comprise a list of non contiguous CE-VLANs. 0 750-0759
This example depicts a range of CE-VLANs.
